intro: Beaucarnea glassiana, commonly known as the glassy tree or moon cactus, is a succulent plant native to the dry regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its swollen, bottle-shaped trunk that stores water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. The plant produces a rosette of fleshy, spiny leaves that are typically pale green or bluish-gray. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters at the top of the plant. Beaucarnea glassiana is popular as a houseplant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
